description: Borrowed from Latin umbō (“a shield boss”).

nouns.description: umbo (plural umbones or umbos or umboes)

entries.meaning: (historical) The boss of a shield, at or near the middle and usually projecting, sometimes in a sharp spike.

definitionGroups.group: (biology) A boss, or rounded elevation, or a corresponding depression, in a palate, disk, or membrane.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) An inward projection of the tympanic membrane of the ear.
(zoology) One of the lateral prominences just above the hinge of a bivalve shell.
(mycology) A bump or protrusion on the cap of a mushroom or toadstool.
